title: Synthetic faults on DHC substation fouling
description:
This dataset contains data generated in the AI DHC project.

***This dataset contains synthetic fault data for fouling of a DHC substation***

The IEA DHC Annex XIII project “Artificial Intelligence for Failure Detection and Forecasting of Heat Production and Heat demand in District Heating Networks” is developing Artificial Intelligence (AI) methods for forecasting heat demand and heat production and is evaluating algorithms for detecting faults which can be used by interested stakeholders (operators, suppliers of DHC components and manufacturers of control devices).

See https://github.com/mathieu-vallee/ai-dhc for the models and pythons scripts used to generate the dataset

Please cite this dataset as:
Vallee, M., Wissocq T., Gaoua Y., Lamaison N., Generation and Evaluation of a Synthetic Dataset to improve Fault Detection in District Heating and Cooling Systems, 2023 (under review at the Energy journal)

Information contained herein have been compiled or arrived from sources believed to be reliable. Nevertheless, the authors or their organizations do not accept liability for any loss or damage arising from the use thereof. Using the given information is strictly your own responsibility.

resources.name: resource0
resources.description:
This file describes the simulated experiments contained in the dataset.

Each experiment is a simulation over 28 days, with a fault possibly appearing at some point in time.

A fault can be of varying type (progressive or abrupt) and intensity.

The intepretation of the intensity depends on the simulation model used.
resources.title: fault_metadata.csv

fields.name: id
fields.title: id
fields.description: Id of the experiment, which also corresponds to a CSV file

fields.name: bc
fields.title: bc
fields.description: Id of the boundary conditions used for this experiment

fields.name: f1_type
fields.title: f1_type
fields.description: Type of fault used in the experiment (0 : no fault, 1: progressive fault, 2 : abrupt fault)

fields.name: f1_start
fields.title: f1_start
fields.description: Start time of the fault, in hours

fields.name: f1_stop
fields.description: Stop time of the fault, in hours
fields.title: f1_stop

fields.name: f1_init
fields.title: f1_init
fields.description: Initial intensity of the fault, in the range [0-1]

fields.name: f1_final
fields.description: Final intensity of the fault, in the range [0-1]
fields.title: f1_final

resources.name: resource1
resources.title: sample_sim_results.csv
resources.description: This file provides data from a simulation without fault

fields.name: TimeDeltaIndex
fields.description: Regular time for each data point (every 10 minutes)

fields.name: Time_s
fields.description: Exact time of the datapoint recorded

fields.name: UA
fields.description: Heat Exchanger thermal conductivity [W/K]

fields.name: POS_%
fields.description: Position of the control valve (0: closed, 1: fully open)

fields.name: TIN_p_degC
fields.description: Temperature at the primary inlet [°C]

fields.name: TOUT_p_degC
fields.description: Temperature at the primary outlet [°C]

fields.name: TIN_s_degC
fields.description: Temperature at the secondary inlet [°C]

fields.name: TOUT_s_degC
fields.description: Temperature at the secondary outlet [°C]

fields.name: UA_mod
fields.description: Thermal conductivity modification (fouling)

fields.name: T_ext_degC
fields.description: External (ambiant) temperature [°C]

fields.name: P_demand_kW
fields.description: Network thermal load [kW]

fields.name: T_supply_degC
fields.description: Network supply temperature [°C]

fields.name: T_return_degC
fields.description: Network return temperature [°C]

fields.name: anomaly
fields.description: Presence of a fault (0: no fault, 1: fault)

resources.name: resource2
resources.description:
This file provides a sample test dataset for the substation fouling fault. 

 Fields are the same as fault_metadata.csv
resources.title: sst_flg_test.csv

resources.name: resource3
resources.description:
This file provides a sample train dataset for the substation fouling fault. 

 Fields are the same as fault_metadata.csv
resources.title: sst_flg_train.csv

resources.name: resource4
resources.title: sim_metadata.json
resources.description: This file provides a more complete description of variables in time series, with units and mapping to Modelica variables.
